qas.question: John XXIII received what prize on 10 May 1963?
When did John XXIII receive the Balzan Prize?
Who officially awarded the pope the Balzan Prize?
Where did he receive the Balzan Prize?
What award was given to Pope Pius XII on May 10, 1963?
Where was Pope Pius XII given the Balzan Prize on May 10, 1963?

plausible_answers.text: deflected achievements of himself to the five popes of his lifetime

qas.question: How did Pope Pius XII feel about receiving the award?
When was Pope Pius XII officially awarded the Balzan Prize by the Italian President?
What was Pope Pius XII suffering from on the way to meet the President of Italy?

context: On <a1_0>10 May 1963<a1_0/>, John XXIII received <b4_0>the <a0_0>Balzan Prize<b4_0/><a0_0/> <b5_0>in private at the Vatican<b5_0/> but <b6_0>deflected achievements of himself to the five popes of his lifetime<b6_0/>, Pope Leo XIII to Pius XII. <b7_0>On 11 May<b7_0/>, the <a2_0>Italian President Antonio Segni<a2_0/> officially awarded Pope John XXIII with the Balzan Prize for his engagement for peace. While in the car en route to the official ceremony, he suffered <b8_0>great stomach pains<b8_0/> but insisted on meeting with Segni to receive the award in <a3_0>the Quirinal Palace<a3_0/>, refusing to do so within the Vatican. He stated that it would have been an insult to honour a pontiff on the remains of the crucified Saint Peter. It was the pope's last public appearance.
